entry.title: Boko Haram disguised as preachers kill at least 24 in Nigeria
entry.summary: "People didn't know the Boko Haram men came for attack because they lied to our people that they came for preaching," said Buba in a telephone conversation.

entry.title: Boko Haram disguised as preachers kill at least 24 in Nigeria
African leaders to hold Boko Haram summit April 8
entry.summary: It will be the first meeting of its kind since Nigeria's election a week ago which was won by Muhammadu Buhari, a former military leader who has vowed to rid his country of the "terror" of Boko Haram.

entry.title: African leaders to hold Boko Haram summit April 8
entry.summary: A coalition involving troops from the four countries has been waging offensives against the Islamists in a bid to crush the insurgency, which has now spread across borders from Boko Haram's stronghold in Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram kill four in Nigeria village raid
entry.summary: This was the first Boko Haram raid in a few days, although an explosion outside a bus station in the northeastern city of Gombe on Thursday that killed 10 people was blamed on the Islamists.

entry.title: Displaced fear Boko Haram violence as elections approach
entry.summary:
Now, it is feared that internally displaced people (IDP) could be next, after Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau vowed to disrupt this Saturday's elections, which the group views as "un-Islamic".

Scores of IDP camps dot Maiduguri following a huge influx of people fleeing towns and villages seized by Boko Haram, doubling the population of the Borno state capital to at least two million.

The discovery backs up previous claims about the danger of Boko Haram infiltrating the camps, including from the Roman Catholic Diocese of Maiduguri last August.

The Kano state government also shut a camp it had opened for people displaced from the town of Mubi in Adamawa, after a Boko Haram insurgent was uncovered.

"One cannot dismiss the political element in the Boko Haram insurgency and the planting of bombs in an IDP camp could be a ploy by politicians averse to holding elections in camps because it doesn't favour their political interest," said Wase.

Last week, scores of Boko Haram killed 11 people in the Borno town of Gamboru after Chadian troops withdrew, in a clear sign that the militants still have the capacity to attack.

entry.title: Fleeing Boko Haram kill seven in attack on village in Chad
entry.summary:
"Some Boko Haram militants fleeing Malam Fatori towards Lake Chad attacked Maidogo, near Ngouboua, on Thursday, killing seven people," said a Chadian security source.

A military offensive by Nigeria and neighboring countries has succeeded in driving Boko Haram, which has killed thousands in its push to create an Islamic caliphate, from most of the positions it held in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Niger President: Boko Haram, 'Islam's worst enemy,' will be beaten
entry.summary:
"There is nothing Islamic about Boko Haram," Issoufou told students and faculty at the Harvard Institute of Politics John F. Kennedy Forum in Cambridge, Massachusetts, during a trip to the United States.

Niger is taking part in a regional operation against Boko Haram in northern Nigeria, a militant group which has launched repeated bloody attacks and abductions in Nigeria and an increasing number of raids into neighboring countries.

Issoufou said Niger's mostly Muslim population broadly supported the alliance, which he said had notched recent successes fighting Boko Haram, and rejected Boko Haram's attempts to carve out its own state in the border region.

entry.title: Boko Haram, 'Islam's worst enemy,' will be beaten: Niger president
entry.summary: "It shows the population of our countries reject terrorism, reject extremism. The population of our countries reject Boko Haram as a Muslim organization," he said.

entry.title: Boko Haram uses children as human bombs, commits 'heinous crimes': UN
entry.summary:
Boko Haram militants have kidnapped more than 400 women and children from Damasak.

It called for those who have committed crimes on behalf of Boko Haram to be brought before competent courts of the affected states and held accountable.

Retreating Boko Haram militants have murdered their so-called "wives" - women and girls they held as slaves - and other captives as military offensives by Nigeria and its neighbours advanced, Zeid said.

The current dry season has intensified Boko Haram incursions into Cameroon, Chad and Niger, spreading bloodshed and desolation even more widely, the rights chief said.

entry.title: Nigerian election winner vows to crush Boko Haram insurgency
entry.summary: "I assure you that Boko Haram will soon know the strength of our collective will and commitment to rid this nation of terror and bring back peace," Buhari said.

entry.title: Nigeria's new leader Muhammadu Buhari says people have put 1-party state behind them - Nigerian civic groups suggest rigging in election - UN official: Boko Haram murdered captive women
entry.summary: "Boko Haram will soon know the strength of our will and commitment to rid this nation of terror ... we shall spare no effort until we defeat terrorism."

entry.title: Nigeria's Buhari says to "spare no effort" in squashing Boko Haram
entry.summary: Despite the killing of more than a dozen voters by Boko Haram gunmen - who had pledged to derail the poll - the election was one of the most orderly in Nigeria's history.

entry.title: Nigeria will 'spare no effort' against Boko Haram
entry.summary: "Boko Haram will soon know the strength of our collective will. We should spare no effort," he said in his first formal speech since winning the election.

entry.title: UN rights chief: Boko Haram fighters murdered captive women
Niger: Troops prevent Boko Haram attack, destroy base
entry.summary: On Saturday, troops from Niger and Chad destroyed a Boko Haram base inside Nigeria, also close to the Niger border, killing 54 militants, the statement said.

entry.title: Niger: Troops prevent Boko Haram attack, destroy base
Chad, Niger troops retake Nigeria border town from Boko Haram
entry.summary: The town of Malam Fatori, which was seized by Boko Haram in November, had been the scene of fighting between coalition forces and the militants, and military sources falsely claimed to have retaken it in January.

entry.title: Mass grave found in recaptured Nigerian town
entry.summary: Chad and Niger launched a vast air and ground offensive against Boko Haram in the area on March 8, quickly taking Damasak from the group.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigerian town, kills 11
entry.summary: But a French diplomat says a more realistic goal is to reduce Boko Haram to what it used to be - an extremist group holding no territory.

entry.title: Eight suspected Boko Haram gunmen killed in NE Nigeria: residents

entry.summary:
Nigeria's military announced Friday it had destroyed the headquarters of Boko Haram's so-called Islamic caliphate and driven the insurgents from all major areas in northeast Nigeria.

International outrage has grown over another failure - the rescue of 219 schoolgirls kidnapped by Boko Haram nearly a year ago.

entry.title: Nigerian Military Claim to Destroy Boko Haram Headquarters
entry.summary: This comes after months of defeat at the hands of Boko Haram, with soldiers fleeing the battlefield after they ran out of ammunition.

entry.title: Footage shows Boko Haram's destruction of Nigerian town Bama - dead bodies and burnt out buildings are all that's left
entry.summary: As Nigerian soldiers patrolled the town, many covered their faces to protect themselves from the stench of dead bodies, while the military vehicles had to avoid the roadblocks left behind by Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigerian military claim to destroy Boko Haram headquarters
entry.summary: The forest starts about 30 kilometers (20 miles) from Gwoza town, which is 130 kilometers (80 miles) southeast of Maiduguri, the capital of Borno state and birthplace of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigerian military, with new weapons, attacks Boko Haram ahead of elections
entry.summary: Despite the military muscle, many of those who fled Boko Haram attacks are reluctant to return home.

entry.title: In shadow of Boko Haram, Cameroon combats extremism at home
entry.summary:
In recent months, Cameroon has arrested dozens of imams and their followers accused of promoting radical ideology and collaborating with Nigeria's Boko Haram militants.

Military operations alone cannot defeat Boko Haram, says Bridgit Ndemba, a sociologist at the University of Yaounde, in the capital.

entry.title: Boko Haram using civilians as human shields, Nigerian official says
entry.summary:
Instead, he said that as troops advanced, Boko Haram rushed to a school where people had been held after the insurgents had seized the town late last year.

Boko Haram has killed thousands of civilians and kidnapped unknown hundreds in its fight to create an Islamic state.

entry.title: Central Africa leaders plan Boko Haram offensive
entry.summary:
The detentions came as police in Niger said they had arrested more than 160 people suspected of having links to Boko Haram in the country's Diffa region, a border area with Nigeria which was attacked by the group this month.

Nigeria-based Boko Haram has widened its attacks into neighbouring nations, notably Cameroon and Chad, in a conflict estimated to have claimed 13,000 lives since 2009.

entry.title: Official: Boko Haram kidnaps hundreds of Nigerian civilians
entry.summary: Damasak, near the border with Niger, was recaptured from Boko Haram on March 16.

entry.title: Boko Haram Kidnaps Hundreds of Nigerian Civilians
entry.summary: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) - Hundreds of civilians, including many children, have been kidnapped and are being used as human shields by Boko Haram extremists, a top Nigerian official confirmed Wednesday.

entry.title: Official: Boko Haram kidnaps hundreds of Nigerian civilians
entry.summary:
When troops from Chad and Niger advanced toward Damasak, Boko Haram began taking captives, said Omeri.

"Boko Haram ... rushed to primary schools they took children and adults that they are using as shields to protect themselves from the menacing advance of troops," said Omeri.

entry.summary: "Two of them were supposed to get married this year. (Boko Haram) said 'They are slaves so we're taking them because they belong to us'," he said.

entry.title: Boko Haram kidnapped hundreds in northern Nigeria town
entry.summary: Boko Haram wants to carve out a caliphate in northern Nigeria and a sharp increase in violence forced a delay in planned elections last month in Africa's most populous country.

entry.title: Boko Haram kidnapped hundreds in northern Nigeria town -residents
entry.summary: Boko Haram's abduction last April of nearly 300 schoolgirls in the region stirred international outrage and drew global attention to the group's six-year insurgency.

entry.title: Chadian helicopters bomb Boko Haram on Nigeria-Niger border -Niger army
entry.summary:
Niger and Chadian soldiers have been fighting the Islamist militants in a joint mission with Nigeria and Cameroon since March 2, in a bid to end Boko Haram's six-year insurgency in northern Nigeria that is threatening regional stability.

"Niger and Chad had received intelligence that a group of Boko Haram fighters had gathered in the border village," the officer said.

The Niger military officer, who requested anonymity, said Boko Haram fighters had moved to Djaboullam after they were chased from other towns by the Nigerian army.

entry.title: Retreating Boko Haram leaves mass of throat-slit corpses near Nigerian town
entry.summary: "People were in town when they (Boko Haram) attacked, they fired at us, we ran away to the bushes but they continued to fire and chased some people to kill them," said Damasak resident Mbodou Moussa.

entry.title: Retreating Boko Haram leaves mass of throat-slit corpses near Nigerian town
entry.summary:
Damasak, Nigeria: Soldiers from Niger and Chad who liberated the Nigerian town of Damasak from Boko Haram militants have discovered the bodies of at least 70 people scattered under a bridge, a witness said.

Weapons captured from Boko Haram by Chadian and Nigerien soldiers are seen in the recently retaken town of Damasak.

A signpost painted by Boko Haram is seen in the recently retaken town of Damasak, Nigeria, near where the massacre of its residents occurred.

On Thursday, however, two security sources said that Boko Haram had killed at least 10 people in the town of Gamburu, on the border with Cameroon, demonstrating it can still attack civilians despite being forced into retreat.

entry.title: Boko Haram 'slaughter wives' in Nigeria
entry.summary: Maiduguri: Dozens of Nigerian women who were forced to marry Boko Haram fighters have reportedly been slaughtered by their "husbands" before a battle with troops in the northeast town of Bama.

entry.title: Boko Haram 'slaughter wives' in Nigeria
Niger troops say find mass grave outside town taken from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
"Niger and Chad's troops have discovered a mass grave at Damasak, which appears to contain the bodies of Boko Haram's victims," said one of the military sources, who asked not to be identified.

Shops and businesses were looted and Boko Haram's black and white insignia were scrawled on buildings around the town.

entry.title: Boko Haram 'getting weaker every day', says Nigeria president
entry.summary:
Goodluck Jonathan, who is seeking re-election on 28 March, said Boko Haram was "getting weaker and weaker every day".

A Boko Haram attack on the border town of Gamboru on Wednesday and Thursday killed 11 civilians and gave an indication of the difficulties in bringing a definitive end to the violence.

Fears remain about the safety of voters on polling day, after a spate of suicide attacks in the north in recent weeks and after Boko Haram's leader, Abubakar Shekau, vowed to disrupt the election.

entry.title: Warning over president's 'victory' claims against Boko Haram
entry.summary: The Nigeria Security Network of analysts on Thursday meanwhile warned that Boko Haram would revert to its guerrilla campaign of bombings and suicide attacks in the face of military pressure.

entry.title: Boko Haram Attacks Nigerian Town, Kills 11

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigerian town, kills 11
entry.summary:
"We were terrified when we started hearing gunshots echoing ... but everywhere became calm about an hour later. The soldiers informed us that it was the Boko Haram terrorists that came back", said Aji Kaumi.

It was the first reported attack on a town previously occupied by Boko Haram since a regional offensive was launched by troops from Chad seven weeks ago.

France brought about the regional cooperation with a summit in Paris last year that eased strained relations between Nigeria and its smaller, francophone neighbors amid growing concern as Boko Haram began launching attacks across Nigeria's borders.

entry.title: African troops' morale 'sky high' as they push back Boko Haram
entry.summary: The vote was delayed by six weeks after security chiefs said they could not guarantee security owing to operations to combat Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram forces attack Nigeria?s Gamboru, slaughter forced wives in Bama amid retreat
entry.summary: Troops from Chad were credited last month with liberating Gamboru in Borno state from Boko Haram control but Chad's withdrawal from Nigeria last week appeared to have left the town exposed.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigeria's Gamboru, women slaughtered in Bama
entry.summary:
Boko Haram forcibly married scores of women in Bama after seizing it in September.

The latest reported atrocities in Bama recall similar massacres at high schools and colleges across northeast Nigeria, where Boko Haram has executed scores of students learning a so-called infidel curriculum.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigeria town of Gamboru, kills 11: witnesses
Nigeria Boko Haram victories may not boost Jonathan in poll
entry.summary: Boko Haram is now on the run and squeezed into ever smaller turf.

entry.title: Proposed UN resolution would endorse military action by an African force against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
The draft resolution expresses "deep concern" that Boko Haram recently pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group.

It declares that terrorist acts by Boko Haram and others constitute "one of the most serious threats to international peace and security."

It "demands that Boko Haram immediately and unequivocally cease all hostilities and all abuses of human rights and violations of international humanitarian law and disarm."

entry.title: UN seeks to endorse military action against Boko Haram
Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls

entry.title: Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls

He said Boko Haram now holds only three of 27 local government areas in Borno, the third northeastern state under a military state of emergency and the birthplace of Boko Haram.

More than 1.5 million people driven from their homes by Boko Haram's nearly 6-year-old Islamic uprising.

In early February, Nigeria's air force began bombarding the Sambisa Forest, a stronghold of Boko Haram where the Chibok girls first were taken.

entry.title: Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls
entry.summary: The admission of lack of progress on the missing schoolgirls comes as the Nigerian military, bolstered by forces from neighboring countries, is regaining towns and cities held by Boko Haram in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigeria says it has pushed Boko Haram out of all but 3 areas
entry.summary: Boko Haram's worsening atrocities against civilians hit international headlines in April last year, when the militants kidnapped more than 200 schoolgirls from the village of Chibok, triggering a search for them that has been fruitless thus far.

entry.title: Nigeria says has pushed Boko Haram out of all but three areas
entry.summary: At the start of this year, Boko Haram controlled around 20 local government areas, a territory the size of Belgium, in its bloody six-year-old campaign to carve out an Islamic state in religiously mixed Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram kills one in north Cameroon attack: army
entry.summary: The Nigerian army said on Tuesday it had repelled Boko Haram from all but three local government districts in the northeast, claiming victory for its offensive against the Islamist insurgents less than two weeks before a presidential election.

entry.title: Nigeria begins 'final onslaught' against Boko Haram: govt

The military announced that Adawama was "cleared" last Friday and that Yobe was retaken on Monday from Boko Haram, who have pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group in Syria and Iraq.

"As for the other three areas (Abadam, Gwoza and Askira), help is coming," said Omeri, who announced last week that 36 towns had been recaptured from Boko Haram.

Jonathan is facing a stiff challenge from the main opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari, a former miliary ruler who has attacked the president's record on tackling Boko Haram.

entry.title: Foreigners train Nigerian troops as "final onslaught" hits Boko Haram
entry.summary: However, this year Nigeria and its neighbors have launched a series of offensives to recapture territory, turning the tide against Boko Haram in the run-up to the hotly contested presidential poll.

entry.title: Foreigners train Nigerian troops as "final onslaught" hits Boko Haram
entry.summary: Africa's most populous nation and top energy producer has been plagued by the Boko Haram insurgency since 2009, when insurgents intensified efforts to establish an Islamic caliphate in the northeastern Borno state.

entry.title: Nigerian, Cameroon troops oust Boko Haram from town, village

entry.title: Boko Haram militants attack village in Chad, killing one
entry.summary:
"Boko Haram elements this morning attacked the village of Djargagoroum, between Ngouboua and Kaiga," said a resident of the targeted village who asked not to be named.

Boko Haram raided nearby Ngouboua, on the shores of Lake Chad, last month in the group's first known lethal attack on Chadian soil.

entry.title: Cameroon says 25 Boko Haram suspects died in custody
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has been fighting a nearly 6-year insurgency against the Nigerian government, killing thousands and carrying out mass kidnappings, including of schoolgirls.

Also on Thursday, Islamic State militants in the Middle East accepted a pledge of allegiance from Boko Haram, though it is unclear how the groups might be able to cooperate effectively.

entry.title: Cameroon says 25 Boko Haram suspects died in custody
entry.summary:
Cameroon's northern region was repeatedly targeted by Boko Haram before the country signed up to participate in a multinational force that has dislodged the group from a score of northeastern Nigerian towns in recent weeks.

Nigeria acknowledged on Thursday that it is getting help from regional security operatives amid reports that South Africa and other foreign contractors are involved in the fight against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Cameroon says 25 Boko Haram suspects died in custody
Children rescued from Boko Haram so traumatised they have forgotten their names
entry.summary:
Nairobi, Kenya: After years in a Boko Haram camp, the children had forgotten their native language.

They had been rescued by the country's military in November from a squalid Boko Haram encampment near the border with Nigeria.

"Even if kinetic operations were to end soon and Boko Haram was taken off the battlefield, it would take years to really address consequences in humanitarian terms."

In April 2014, Boko Haram grabbed the world's attention when fighters abducted 200 schoolgirls in northern Nigeria.

entry.title: France increases its efforts to back African forces fighting Boko Haram
entry.summary: The operation to fight Boko Haram is "flexible," which means that some troops can be redeployed from one country to another, one of the officials said without giving more details.

entry.title: France Increases Its Efforts in the Fight Against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
France supports the offensive led by Chad in cooperation with Cameroon, Niger and Nigeria - Boko Haram's base.

France's defense minister said this week that the country would "slightly" increase its number of troops in the Sahel region by the end of the year, but does not intend to take active part in the fighting against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: "The prompt - one might even say 'fast-tracked' - acceptance by the so-called Islamic State of Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance" underscores that both needed the propaganda boost from the affiliation, Pham added.

entry.title: ISIS accepts Boko Haram pledge, says would-be recruits can go to Nigeria
entry.summary: Peter Pham, director of the Africa Center at the Atlantic Council, a think tank in Washington, noted the Islamic State group's quick acceptance of Boko Haram's allegiance and said that the bond highlights a new risk.

entry.title: IS accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: Islamic State militants have accepted a pledge of allegiance by the Nigerian-grown Boko Haram extremist group, a spokesman for the Islamic State movement said Thursday.

entry.title: Islamic State accepts Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: Members of the U.N. Security Council proposed Thursday that the international community supply money, equipment, troops and intelligence to a five-nation African force fighting Boko Haram.

entry.title: Islamic State accepts Boko Haram allegiance
entry.summary: "Our caliph, God save him, has accepted the pledge of loyalty of our brothers of Boko Haram so we congratulate Muslims and our jihadi brothers in West Africa," said IS spokesman Abu Mohammad al-Adnani.

entry.title: Chad, Niger troops push Boko Haram out of two Nigerian towns
entry.summary: Troops from Chad and Niger have freed two towns in northern Nigeria previously held by Boko Haram, the first gains made in a joint offensive launched at the weekend, military sources said on Monday.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: In the message published on his Twitter account on Saturday, Abubakar Shekau, Boko Haram's leader, announced that he had sworn allegiance to the Islamic State, also known as ISIS.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
If confirmed, the pledge would make the group, Boko Haram, which is believed to have as many as 6,000 fighters, the largest extremist group to date to agree to fight under the Islamic State banner, analysts said.

Terrorism experts say that the pledge, or "bayat", is a spiritually binding oath, and it indicates that Boko Haram's leader agrees to be under the authority of the Islamic State group.

If confirmed, the agreement with Boko Haram would mirror the steps taken by Islamic State affiliates in Libya, Algeria, Egypt, Afghanistan and beyond.

"But the biggest issue with Boko Haram is that it's not a homogeneous group and it behaves as different factions. So it's too early to tell for sure if Boko Haram will fall directly under ISIS command, and to what extent they will act as an ISIS proxy."

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: "It's quite clear that since at least mid-January, the Islamic State has had some level of connection with Boko Haram," said Aaron Zelin, a fellow at the Washington Institute who tracks propaganda by Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to ISIS
entry.summary: "We announce our allegiance to the Caliph ... and will hear and obey in times of difficulty and prosperity," a Boko Haram leader pledged in the unverified message that emerged Saturday.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: The Twitter account, increasingly slick and more frequent video messages from Boko Haram, and a new media arm all are considered signs that the group is being helped by IS propagandists.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State

entry.title: Nigeria?s Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
The pledge to IS came in an Arabic audio message with English subtitles alleged to have come from Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau and posted Saturday on Twitter, according to the SITE Intelligence monitoring service.

The Boko Haram pledge to IS comes as the Nigerian militants reportedly are massing in the northeastern town of Gwoza, considered their headquarters, for a showdown with a Chadian-led multinational force.

Though there was no way to independently verify the message, it comes weeks after Boko Haram's new Twitter account broadcast that the group's Shura council was considering whether to swear formal allegiance to IS.

entry.title: Lakeside communities in Chad live in fear of Boko Haram

entry.title: Surrender or face death: Chad president to Boko Haram leader

Chad's army has waged a series of battles against Boko Haram as part of a cross-border military campaign and has re-taken territory the militant group held in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Chad president tells Boko Haram leader to surrender or face death

On Wednesday, a bomb planted and remotely detonated by Boko Haram militants near the southeastern Niger town of Diffa killed two soldiers and wounded a third, Niger military sources said.

entry.title: Boko Haram fails to unite African allies as Chad and Cameroon wait for Nigerian support

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Nigerian troops pose with a flag of Boko Haram after dismantling terrorists from their camp along Djimitillo Damaturu Road, Yobe State in northeastern Nigeria, following fierce fighting there.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Nigeria's Islamist sect Boko Haram released a video purporting to show it beheading two men, its first online posting using advanced graphics and editing techniques reminiscent of footage from Islamic State.

entry.title: Boko Haram beheading video suggests group is 'incorporating itself into Islamic State' with 'Isis-like' production techniques
entry.summary: Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan has said Boko Haram is allied to both al-Qaeda and Isis, though that has not been confirmed by the group itself.

entry.title: Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing IS
entry.summary:
The Boko Haram film's use of graphics, the footage of black-clad militants with a black flag, and the editing to show only the aftermath of the beheading, were particularly reminiscent of footage from IS, which has seized large parts of Iraq and Syria and killed several hostages.

In the film, one of the men says he comes from Baga in Borno state, and the other says he is from Michika in Adamawa state, both areas where the army says it has recently recaptured territory from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram beheadings video echoes Isis techniques
entry.summary: Past Boko Haram films have been cruder, often featuring a man identified as the leader Abubakar Shekau discussing local gripes instead of preaching global jihad.

entry.title: Nigeria?s Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Boko Haram has killed thousands and kidnapped hundreds in its bid to carve out an Islamist state in its homeland, and in recent months has increased cross-border raids into Cameroon, Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Nigeria stalls Chad, aims to beat Boko Haram before election
entry.summary:
But with presidential elections this month, Nigeria is keen to press ahead with its own military campaign against Boko Haram, aiming to push it out of major towns before the March 28 ballot.

Officials from Chad, Niger and Cameroon say lack of cooperation from Nigeria has for months hampered efforts to put together a regional taskforce against Boko Haram.

Boko Haram was long regarded by neighboring countries as an internal Nigerian problem, but attacks in Cameroon and Niger last year prompted the regional response.

Another senior Cameroon military figure said they were attempting to choke off Boko Haram's revenues, including the trade in fuel with Cameroon, Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Chadian troops seize Nigerian town of Dikwa from Boko Haram
entry.summary: He added that many Boko Haram fighters had also been killed in the clashes on Monday in northeastern Nigeria, the Islamist group's stronghold.

entry.title: New Boko Haram Video Appears To Show Two Captives Beheaded
entry.summary: Boko Haram began emulating the Islamic State group last August, declaring it had established an Islamic caliphate in territory it controls in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram video shows 2 beheaded men accused of spying
entry.summary:
The SITE intelligence group said the video called "Harvest of Spies" was posted Monday on Twitter by Boko Haram's new media arm.

Boko Haram has said in social media messages last month that it is considering swearing allegiance to IS.

Boko Haram previously published only one beheading, of a Nigerian fighter pilot whose plane went missing in September.

entry.title: Boko Haram video shows 2 beheaded men accused of spying
Boko Haram kill villagers after fleeing offensive
entry.summary: For most of the past year, Boko Haram has been gaining strength, seizing territory the size of Belgium and kidnapping hundreds of people, mostly women and children.

entry.title: Boko Haram fighters kill 21 people near Nigeria's Chibok
In camps, Nigerian refugees fear for family left to Boko Haram
entry.summary: Then, on Oct. 1, the area was again attacked by Boko Haram fighters.

entry.title: Nigerian planes bomb Boko Haram camps, military says
entry.summary:
"The death of a large number of terrorists has been recorded while many others are also scampering all over the forest," defence spokesman Major-General Chris Olukolade said on Thursday, later adding that an attack was under way on parts of Gwoza, the town where Boko Haram first declared an Islamic state last year.

Sambisa gained notoriety last year when more than 200 girls kidnapped by Boko Haram from a secondary school in nearby Chibok were taken there.

entry.title: Nigerian army says 300 Boko Haram militants killed
entry.summary: The military says it's killed 300 Boko Haram fighters in an operation to recapture 11 towns and villages.

entry.title: U.S. to aid African allies in fight against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Boko Haram killed an estimated 10,000 people last year in its campaign to carve an Islamist emirate from northern Nigeria.

Chad's military, which played a leading role in a French-led campaign that ousted Islamist groups from northern Mali in 2013, has already led attacks against Boko Haram positions in Nigeria's border regions.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat
entry.summary:
While the upcoming multinational force against Boko Haram is not a specific focus of Flintlock, the training is aimed at broader themes that will apply to that mission.

Thiebes said the training is going ahead despite a recent series of Boko Haram attacks on Niger and Cameroon.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat
entry.summary: Now the most imminent danger to regional security is Boko Haram, which killed at least 10,000 people in Nigeria last year and is now staging cross-border attacks in Cameroon, Niger and Chad.

entry.title: Nigeria claims to have killed 300 Boko Haram militants in recapture of 11 towns
300 Boko Haram fighters killed in north Nigeria
entry.summary: Meanwhile, Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau vowed to disrupt Nigeria's general election in a video released yesterday.

entry.title: Cameroon army kills 86 Boko Haram militants
Boko Haram issues new threat against Niger, Chad
entry.summary: On Monday, leaders in Central Africa said that 10 member states had agreed to contribute most of the $100 million needed to combat Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram Issues New Threat Against Niger, Chad
Boko Haram launches fresh assault on Gombe,?Nigeria
entry.summary:
Boko Haram left the town in a convoy of vehicles carrying dozens of corpses, according to residents.

Boko Haram's Islamic extremist insurgency killed 10,000 people last year, according to the U.S. Council on Foreign Relations.

entry.title: Nigerian military repels Boko Haram attack on northeast town
entry.summary:
BAUCHI, Nigeria (AP) - Nigeria's military Saturday repelled an attack on a northeastern town by Boko Haram Islamic extremists who, as they retreated, warned residents not to participate in the country's elections in March.

The Associated Press obtained a copy of the message in which Boko Haram warned that its fighters will attack all polling stations in the March 28 elections.

entry.title: Boko Haram city attack repelled
Boko Haram attacks Chad village as revolt spreads
entry.summary: Chad's army, one of the best in the region, has joined a regional offensive against Boko Haram and says it has killed hundreds of fighters in the past fortnight.

entry.title: Boko Haram Fight Intensifies In West Africa
entry.summary: Abubakar Shekau is the leader of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram carries out first attack in Chad
entry.summary: "They (Boko Haram) killed 12 people in Akida village and nine others in Mbuta village during a raid," said community leader Mustapha Abbagini.

entry.title: Boko Haram Launches First Attack on Chadian Village
entry.summary: Boko Haram's insurgency has forced some 157,000 people to seek refuge in Niger, while 40,000 others have gone to Cameroon and 17,000 are in Chad, the U.N. said.

entry.title: Boko Haram Launches First Attack on Chadian Village
entry.summary: Ngouboua is already home to nearly 3,300 refugees who had fled Boko Haram-related violence back home in Nigeria, according to the United Nations.

entry.title: Boko Haram launches first attack on Chadian village
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has expanded its attacks against neighboring countries over the past week following threats to punish any nations contributing to the fight against the terror group.

Chad, Niger, Cameroon and Benin all have pledged to send military support though Chadian soldiers are already fighting Boko Haram militants inside Cameroon and Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram launches first attack in Chad
entry.summary: Dozens of Boko Haram fighters arrived in the early hours of the morning on motorized canoes at the fishing village on the shores of Lake Chad, setting houses ablaze and attacking a police station.

entry.title: Boko Haram extends terror reach in first attack on Chad
entry.summary: A multinational force to fight Boko Haram is expected to be launched in the coming weeks.

entry.title: Boko Haram stages first attack on Chad
Boko Haram attacks Chadian village as revolt spreads
entry.summary:
In a bid to contain Boko Haram, which has killed thousands and kidnapped hundreds in its five-year revolt, President Idriss Deby's government mediated peace talks between the Nigerian government and the group last October.

The talks sought to secure the release of 200 schoolgirls from Nigeria's Chibok but Boko Haram later said it had married off the schoolgirls to its fighters.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Chadian village as revolt spreads
entry.summary: Nigeria has postponed for six weeks a presidential election that had been due on Saturday, citing the security threat from Boko Haram.
